items.title: PolitiFact: Fact-checking US politics
items.snippet:
PolitiFact is a fact-checking website that rates the accuracy of claims by elected 
officials and others on its Truth-O-Meter.
items.htmlSnippet:

officials and others on its Truth-O-Meter.

metatags.og:title: Fact-checking Donald Trump's statement on Saudi Arabia
metatags.og:description:
President Donald Trump’s view that the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi should not touch U.S.-Saudi relations isn’t being well-received by his fellow Republicans. For example,
                   Trump cast doubt over the CIA’s conclusion that Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the killing. Sen. Mike Lee,
                   R-Utah,
                   said he disagreed with Trump.
metatags.twitter:title:
Fact-checking Donald Trump's statement on Saudi Arabia,
                   Khashoggi murder
metatags.twitter:description:
President Donald Trump’s view that the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi should not touch U.S.-Saudi relations isn’t being well-received by his fellow Republicans. For example,
                   Trump cast doubt over the CIA’s conclusion that Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the killing. Sen. Mike Lee,
                   R-Utah,
                   said he disagreed with Trump. "The intelligence I’ve seen suggests that this was ordered by the crown prince,
                  " Lee said on NBC News’ Meet the Press Nov. 25. Sen. Joni Ernst,
                   R-Iowa,
                   was more cautious,
                   but she told CNN’s State of the Union that "when it becomes necessary,
                   the president also needs to ...

rigged, " in favor of energy companies, according to Clean Virginia, an advocacy ...

metatags.og:title: Clean Virginia tells half the story about state's high energy bills
metatags.og:description: Virginians pay high power bills largely because the state’s regulatory system is
metatags.twitter:title: Clean Virginia tells half the story about state's high energy bills
metatags.twitter:description:
Virginians pay high power bills largely because the state’s regulatory system is "rigged,
                  " in favor of energy companies,
                   according to Clean Virginia,
                   an advocacy group seeking reforms.   The group notes on its website that the state’s two dominant power companies - Dominion Energy and Appalachian Power Co.,
                   who,
                   together provide 82 percent of Virginia’s power and have contributed $12 million to state candidates since 1996 - have had a major role in writing the laws that regulate them. As a result,
                   "Virginians pay the 11th-highest power bills in the nation,
                  " Clean Virginia says. We wondered whether that ranking is ...
